ab.title: Genesis 15
ab.l: After these things the words of prophecy of the Lord cameto Abram through a vision of prophecy, saying, ‘Do not fear,Abram, I am a shield for you. Your reward is very large,seg type="commented" n="#seg005"/because you have shown the love of brotherhood and you have savedLot, the son of your brother, from the hands of enemiesanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg005"/’.
But Abram said, ‘Oh Lord God, what rewardwill you give me: I walk alone, childless and the rulerof my house is Eliezer of Damascus?’
AndAbram said, ‘Lo, you have not given me offspring, and, lo, the elderof my house, he will inherit |from| me.’
And, lo, the words of prophecyof the Lord |came| to him, saying, ‘He will not inherit |from| you, buthe who will come out of your insides will inherit |from| you.’
Andhe brought him outside and said, ‘Look now at the skiesand count the stars, if you are able to count them.’And he said to him, ‘So many will your descendants be.’
Andhe believed the words of the Lord, and God counted it to himon merit.
And he said to him, ‘I am the Lord that brought you out ofUr of the Chaldees, to give you this land,to inherit it.’
And he said, ‘Lord God,how shall I know that I will inherit it?’
And he saidto him, ‘Take me seg type="commented" n="#seg006"/three calves, and three goats, and three ramsanchor type="commented" xml:id="seg006"/,and a turtledove, and a quail.’
And he took to himall these, and he split them up the middle, and he setthe half of one person opposite that of the other, buthe did not divide the birds.
And the birds of prey came down on the carcasses,and Abram scared them off.
And whenthe sun was going down, a deep sleep fell on Abram.And, lo, fear, great darkness fell on him.
And the Lord said to Abram, ‘Know for certainthat your offspring will be strangers in a land that is not theirsfor four hundred years, and they shall be servants, and they will be afflicted by them.
But I will adjudge that kingdom whom they shall serve,and afterward they will come out with great possessions.
And you shall go to your fathers in peace, you shall be buriedin a good old age.
And they shall come back here in the fourth generation,because the sins of the Amorites are not yet complete to that time.’
And it was that the sun went down, and it was dark,and, lo, a smoking furnace and a burning torch that passed betweenthose halves.
On that daythe Lord made a covenant with Abram, saying, ‘I will give this land to your offspring,starting from the river of Egyptto the great river, the river Euphrates:
TheKenites, and the Kenizzites, and the Kadmonites,
And the Hittites, and the Perizzites, and theRephaim,
And the Amorites, and theCanaanites, and the Girgashites, and the Jebusites.’

app.note: A mistranslation repeated in a number of manuscripts, cf. the text in Gen 15:10–11 and Heb. עֶגְלָה מְשֻׁלֶּשֶׁת וְעֵז מְשֻׁלֶּשֶׁת וְאַיִל מְשֻׁלָּשׁ ‘a heifer three years old, a female goat three years old, a ram three years old’. Translated correctly in V, and R.
